dublinCore.title: Color Wheel Harmonies
creator: Claude AI
Dan McCreary
subject: Art
Design
Color Theory
dublinCore.description: An interactive MicroSim for exploring color relationships including complementary, analogous, triadic, and split-complementary color harmonies through an interactive color wheel.

learningObjectives: Identify the 12 colors on a traditional color wheel
Understand how color relationships are determined by angular distance
Analyze why certain color combinations feel harmonious or tense
Apply color harmony principles to design choices
Compare the visual effects of different harmony modes
prerequisites: Basic understanding of primary and secondary colors
Familiarity with the concept of hue

controls.name: harmonySelect
controls.label: Harmony Mode
controls.description: Selects which color harmony relationship to display

controls.name: wheelClick
controls.description: Click on the color wheel to select a base color

controls.name: wheelDrag
controls.description: Drag around the wheel to change selection smoothly

simulation.assumptions: Uses HSB color model with 360 degree hue wheel
simulation.limitations: Does not account for perceptual color differences or pigment-based color mixing

learningObjectives: Understand the key concepts of this concept
Explore this concept through interactive visualization
Apply knowledge of this concept to solve problems
Experiment with parameters to observe their effects on this concept
